com.appglu.android.analytics
Class AnalyticsApi

java.lang.Object
  com.appglu.android.analytics.AnalyticsApi

public final class AnalyticsApi
extends Object

AnalyticsApi is used to log events to AppGlu allowing it to collect mobile app usage statistics.

Since:
1.0.0
See Also:
AppGlu, AnalyticsOperations, AsyncAnalyticsOperations

Constructor Summary
AnalyticsApi(AnalyticsDispatcher analyticsDispatcher, AnalyticsRepository analyticsRepository)
           
 
Method Summary
 void logEvent(AnalyticsSessionEvent event)
          Creates a new AnalyticsSessionEvent event.
 void logEvent(String name)
          Creates a new AnalyticsSessionEvent event with the current date and no parameters.
 void logEvent(String name, Map<String,String> parameters)
          Creates a new AnalyticsSessionEvent event with the current date.
 void onActivityPause(android.app.Activity activity)
          Should be called from every Activity.onPause() of your application.
 void onActivityResume(android.app.Activity activity)
          Should be called from every Activity.onResume() of your application.
Another alternative is to extend from any AppGlu super class that already does this for you.

          Remove the callback to stop receiving its events.
 void removeSessionParameter(String name)
          Removes a parameter of AnalyticsSession.
 void setSessionCallback(AnalyticsSessionCallback sessionCallback)
          Set this callback to receive the AnalyticsSession objects before they saved or sent to the server.
This will allow you to change them before they are sent to the REST API.

          Adds or updates a parameter of AnalyticsSession.

Constructor Detail

AnalyticsApi

public AnalyticsApi(AnalyticsDispatcher analyticsDispatcher,
                    AnalyticsRepository analyticsRepository)
Method Detail

setSessionCallback

public void setSessionCallback(AnalyticsSessionCallback sessionCallback)
Set this callback to receive the AnalyticsSession objects before they saved or sent to the server.
This will allow you to change them before they are sent to the REST API.

removeSessionCallback

public void removeSessionCallback()
Remove the callback to stop receiving its events.

onActivityResume

public void onActivityResume(android.app.Activity activity)
Should be called from every Activity.onResume() of your application.
Another alternative is to extend from any AppGlu super class that already does this for you.

Parameters:
activity - the Activity that wants to sent analytics events
See Also:
AppGluAnalyticsActivity, AppGluAnalyticsExpandableListActivity, AppGluAnalyticsFragmentActivity, AppGluAnalyticsListActivity, AppGluAnalyticsPreferenceActivity, AppGluAnalyticsTabActivity

onActivityPause

public void onActivityPause(android.app.Activity activity)
Should be called from every Activity.onPause() of your application. Another alternative is to extend from any AppGlu super class that already does this for you.

Parameters:
activity - the Activity that wants to sent analytics events
See Also:
AppGluAnalyticsActivity, AppGluAnalyticsExpandableListActivity, AppGluAnalyticsFragmentActivity, AppGluAnalyticsListActivity, AppGluAnalyticsPreferenceActivity, AppGluAnalyticsTabActivity

public void setSessionParameter(String name,
                                String value)
Adds or updates a parameter of AnalyticsSession.

Parameters:
name - the parameter name
value - the parameter value
See Also:
AnalyticsSession

removeSessionParameter

public void removeSessionParameter(String name)
Removes a parameter of AnalyticsSession.

Parameters:
name - the parameter name
See Also:
AnalyticsSession

logEvent

public void logEvent(String name)
Creates a new AnalyticsSessionEvent event with the current date and no parameters.

Parameters:
name - the event name

logEvent

public void logEvent(String name,
                     Map<String,String> parameters)
Creates a new AnalyticsSessionEvent event with the current date.

Parameters:
name - the event name
parameters - name and value of all parameters to be added to this event

logEvent

public void logEvent(AnalyticsSessionEvent event)
Creates a new AnalyticsSessionEvent event.

Parameters:
event - the AnalyticsSessionEvent object
